reviewText: I used to be a dance teacher and I'm starting to teach my two young daughters dance.  I found this DVD to be cheezy, too simple, too short and too 80's.  Even the Jazz music it comes with sounds like an 80's department store CD.  Sorry, but don't waste your money on this one.

My daughter is 7 and has been taking ballet and has had some jazz classes.  She finds this DVD instructual but a little fast.  She says she was really struggling to keep up--I did instruct her to stop the action and rewind to catch up with the steps.  She says she did enjoy it.
My granddaughter love this dance DVD it is fun and step, by step, they spend hours dancing and laughing
Just okay. My daughter only watched it a few times.
I bought this thinking it would help both of my daughters who are new dancers, ages 4 and 14. They liked it okay but didn't love it.

I have ordered several dance DVDs for toddlers, only one of them caught my girl's attention and made her want to follow the instructions on the video. This one wasn't a successful purchase. I personally find it a bit old-fashioned and not fun enough to interest a young kid. It has some basic jazz steps, but nothing about them motivates the viewer to participate and try them. The background music does not correspond to the moves, as if they are not moving to music at all. The quality is very nice though, I guess the overall idea was good, but didn't work for us.
I purchased this video for my dancing granddaughter.  We watched it and I think she likes it, I do!  I recommend it.
The dvd was cute and entertainig enough for my 5yr old granddaughter. She uses it everytime she comes to visits; it keeps her entertained.
This product is ok for younger than seven years old...my daughter was bored with it after one viewing....
